name: King George V
acquisitionMethod: Event: Scherzo of Iron and Blood

1.name: Armament Optimization
1.description: Every 24s: 40.0% (70.0%) chance to fire a special barrage. While equipping the Quadruple 356 mm Main Gun: decreases this ship's first Salvo load time by 55.0% (75.0%), increases its Main Gun Crit Rate by 10.0% (20.0%), decreases its Spread Range by 2, and improves the barrage.

2.name: The Glory of the Never-Setting Sun
2.description: Increases this ship's DMG against Sakura Empire, Iron Blood, Sardinia, and Siren ships by 4.0% (10.0%). When your fleet contains 3 or more Royal Navy ships (excluding this ship): increases this ship's FP, RLD, EVA, and AA by 4.0% (20.0%).

1.name: King George V
1.description: King George V-class battleship – King George V.

2.name: Rose's Regalia
2.description: Sorry to keep you waiting, Commander... I don't get to wear a dress very often, so it took me a bit longer. Let's get going, then. Remember, you'll be the lead tonight. Haha~

1.chinese: 英王乔治五世级战列舰—英王乔治五世，舷号41
1.chineseTL: King George V-class Battleship - King George V, Hull Number 41
1.japanese: キングジョージⅤ級戦艦・キング・ジョージ5世(HMS King George V)
1.japaneseTL: King George V-class Battleship - King George V
1.english: King George V-class battleship – King George V.

2.chinese: 英王乔治五世级命名舰，正是我，担任过本土舰队旗舰，也参与过不少作战，还和俾斯麦交过手，不过那次打得不够尽兴，要是在这边还能再交手就好了……至于其他的，你想知道我的什么呢？
2.chineseTL: The lead ship of the King George V-class, that is myself. I served as a flagship for my country's naval fleet and participated in numerous battles. I also faced off against Bismarck once, but I did not get to enjoy myself fully... I hope we can face off again sometime... Other than that, is there anything you would like to know about myself?
2.japanese: キングジョージ5世級のネームシップとは私のことだ。本土艦隊の旗艦を務め、数々の作戦に参加し、かのビスマルクとの対決もやり遂げた。だが、あの時は十分戦えなかったゆえ、願わくばもう一度彼女と手合わせできればよいが……ほかになにか知りたいことがあれば申すが良い
2.japaneseTL: The lead ship of the King George V-class, that is myself. Serving as a flagship for my country's naval fleet, I participated in numerous battles and had a fateful showdown against Bismarck. However, at that time I did not get to fully enjoy the battle, I hope I can face off against her again... Other than that, please let me know if there is anything else you would like to know about myself.
2.english: The nameship of the King George V-class battleships is none other than me. I served as flagship for my country, leading the fleet into numerous battles including the fateful encounter with Bismarck. After getting a brief taste of that thrill, I have been craving to cross swords with her once again... But I digress - is there anything else you'd like to know about me?

3.chinese: 新的战场吗，呵呵，让我好等啊……那么，你就是我的指挥官吗？英王乔治五世，为你效劳
3.chineseTL: A new battlefield? Hoho, I have been long waiting for this... That means, you are my Commander? King George V, at your service.
3.japanese: ここが新たな戦場か。ふふ、待たせてくれる……ということは、あなたが我が指揮官か。我が名はキングジョージ5世だ、上手く使いこなすが良い
3.japaneseTL: So this is my new battlefield. Fufu, I have been waiting for this... That means, you are my Commander? My name is King George V, do command me well.
3.english: So this is my new battlefield. Ahh, how I've long awaited this... By the way, are you my commander? You are in the presence of King George V – do use me well.

4.japanese: 指揮官、ディナーは済んだか？
4.japaneseTL: Commander, have you had dinner yet?
4.english: Commander, did you already partake of supper?

5.chinese: 你问我在皇家的地位？嗯……如果一定要类比的话，大概是骑士长吧？呵呵
5.chineseTL: You ask about my standing within the Royal Family? Hmm... If we had to draw a comparison, I should be "Knight Commander"? Haha
5.japanese: ロイヤルにおける私の地位が気がかりか？ふむ……そうだな、例えるなら「騎士長」というのが一番相応しかろう。ははは
5.japaneseTL: You ask about my standing within the Royal Family? Hmm... Ah right, if we had to draw a comparion, "Knight Commander" would probably be the most fitting. Hahaha
5.english: My standing within the Royal Family? Hmm... If I had to draw a comparison, I'd say "Knight Commander" would be the most fitting... Hahaha...

6.chinese: 指挥官，这里的一切要有你在才能运转起来，可不要懈怠啊
6.chineseTL: Commander, everything in here requires you to operate properly, make sure not to slack off.
6.japanese: 指揮官、あなたがいてこその艦隊だ。気を抜くなよ
6.japaneseTL: Commander, this fleet has been all thanks to you. Make sure not to slack off.
6.english: Commander, this fleet only functions because of you. Don't get sloppy on us.

7.chinese: 约克和威尔士？呵呵，虽然她们不会抱着我的手臂喊我姐姐大人有点遗憾，不过有个性是好事
7.chineseTL: York and Wales? Hoho, it's a shame they won't hold my arms and call me Big Sister, but having strong personalities is a good thing.
7.japanese: ウェールズたちか。本当は腕に抱きつかれ、「姉さま」「姉さま」と呼んでほしいものだが――そんな我があっても良かろう
7.japaneseTL: Wales and York? Honestly, I wished they would hold my arms and call me "Nee-sama" "Nee-sama" but... It's also good that they have such strong personalities.
7.english: Wales and Yorkie? It's a bit of a shame that they don't act more like cute little sisters, but I am glad that they have strong personalities.

8.chinese: 对我来说，世上没有比伊丽莎白女王陛下更值得侍奉的君主了，你能明白吗，指挥官
8.chineseTL: To me, there is no monarch in the world more worthy to serve for than Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth. You can understand, right, Commander?
8.japanese: 私にとって、陛下ほど仕え甲斐のある方は存在しない。指揮官、分かってくれるか？
8.japaneseTL: To me, there exists no one more worthy to serve for than Her Majesty. Commander, can you understand?
8.english: In my eyes, there is no leader in this world more worthy of my loyalty than Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth. Does that make sense to you, Commander?

9.chinese: 皇家的食物都是黑暗料理？哼，这只是以偏概全而已！
9.chineseTL: Royal food is all "Dark Cuisine"? Hmph, that's just a stereotype!
9.chineseNote: "Dark Cuisine" is how Chinese netizens describe British food, "It's just potatoes, potatoes and more potatoes."
9.japanese: ロイヤル料理はゲテモノだらけだと？ふん、木を見て森を見ずとは感心しないな
9.japaneseTL: Royal cuisine is just full of bizarre food? Hmph, I'm not impressed that you are missing the point.
9.english: The Royals' cuisine is all bland? Hogwash. That's just an unfortunate stereotype.

10.chinese: 为什么这里有山一样多的零食？不吃饱怎么有精力做事呢，对吧
10.chineseTL: Why is there a mountain of snacks here? There's no energy to work if you don't eat until you're full, right?
10.japanese: このスナックの山？腹いっぱい食わねば万全に働けまい
10.japaneseTL: This mountain of snacks? I can work hard once my stomach is full.
10.english: Why do I have a mountain of snacks before me? Isn't it obvious? One cannot move on an empty stomach.

11.chinese: 哦？没想到指挥官原来是这么大胆的人啊
11.chineseTL: Oh? I didn't think Commander turned out to be such a brave person.
11.japanese: ほぉ？指揮官がこうも豪胆だとは思わなかったな
11.japaneseTL: Hoo? I didn't think Commander turned out to be this brave.
11.english: Ohh? I wasn't aware that you possessed such audacity, Commander.

12.chinese: 任务啊，要是有些挑战性就再好不过了
12.chineseTL: Mission? It would be nice if we got something more challenging.
12.japanese: 任務か。もう少し挑み甲斐があるといいものを
12.japaneseTL: Another mission? It would be nice if we got something a bit more challenging.
12.english: New missions, eh? It would be ideal if we got something a bit more challenging.

13.chinese: 完成任务后的饭果然是最美味的，对吧，指挥官
13.chineseTL: The meal after completing missions tastes the best. Right, Commander?
13.japanese: 任務をこなした後のディナーが一番美味い。そうだろう？指揮官
13.japaneseTL: The dinner after completing missions is the tastiest. Don't you agree, Commander?
13.english: Supper tastes best after the day's missions are all complete. Wouldn't you agree, Commander?

14.chinese: 信件……呵，是战书呢，还是情书呢？
14.chineseTL: A letter... Hmm, is it a letter of challenge, or a love letter?
14.japanese: 手紙……さて、挑戦状か、それともラブレターか？
14.japaneseTL: Letter... Now then, is it a letter of challenge, or a love letter?
14.english: A letter, huh? Now then, is this a challenge, or a love letter?

15.chinese: 在战场上纵横愉快吗，指挥官？
15.chineseTL: Did you have a good time in the battlefield, Commander?
15.japanese: 指揮官、戦は楽しめたか？
15.japaneseTL: Commander, did you enjoy the battle?
15.english: Commander, did you thoroughly enjoy the battle?

16.chinese: 港口那边有些动静？哦，是委托组回来了啊
16.chineseTL: There is some commotion at the port? Oh, the commissions team just returned.
16.japanese: 埠頭に動きあり……？おや、委託組が戻ってきてくれたようだな
16.japaneseTL: There is some commotion at the port...? Oh, it seems like the commissions team has returned.
16.english: There's some commotion by the port...? Oh, it seems to just be the commission team returning.

17.chinese: 嗯……突然有想大吃一顿的冲动呢
17.chineseTL: Hmm... I suddenly got the urge for a feast.
17.japanese: うむ……一度どか食いがしたい気分だな
17.japaneseTL: Umu... I suddenly feel like feasting.
17.english: Hmm... I suddenly feel like having a lavish feast.

18.chinese: 在这里也留下我们的威名吧！
18.chineseTL: Let us engrave our resounding names here!
18.japanese: 我らが威名をここにも轟かせよう！
18.japaneseTL: Let us engrave our resounding names here!
18.english: Let us go forth and plant our banners!

19.chinese: 不要大意，胜利和各位的安全，我都要
19.chineseTL: Do not be careless, victory and the safety of everyone here, I want them both.
19.japanese: 油断はせん。勝利も諸君らの身の無事もうまく総取りしてくれよう
19.japaneseTL: Do not let your guard down. Let's ensure both victory and the safety of everyone here.
19.english: Make no mistakes. I shall ensure both victory and the safety of all my comrades.

20.chinese: 无需气馁，真正的胜负可不是一场战斗能左右的
20.chineseTL: No need to be discouraged, the real victory or defeat is not decided by only one battle.
20.japanese: 落ち込むな。己が勝敗は一戦で決するものではない
20.japaneseTL: Don't feel discouraged. One's victory or defeat is not decided by only one battle.
20.english: Do not be demoralized. Neither victory nor defeat are decided by a single battle.

21.chinese: 日不落的辉光永不散去！
21.chineseTL: The glory of the never-setting Sun shall never yield!
21.japanese: 沈まぬ太陽の威光は、色褪せはせん！
21.japaneseTL: The glory of the never-setting Sun shall never fade!
21.english: The glory of the sun that never sets shall not fade!

23.chinese: 指挥官，我喜欢有个性或者会做饭的人，而你，不行
23.chineseTL: Commander, I like someone of character or someone who can cook. As for you, neither.
23.japanese: 我がある、もしくは料理を支度してくれる子を好むが。指揮官、あなたはどちらでもないようだな
23.japaneseTL: I like someone of character, or someone who can cook. Commander, you don't seem to be either.
23.english: I favor those of character, and those who can cook. Commander, you are neither.

24.chinese: 说起来，指挥官，你会做饭吗？别看我这样，为了满足自己的胃，我在厨艺上可是下了许多功夫的
24.chineseTL: By the way, Commander, can you cook? I may not look like it, in order to satisfy my own appetite, I have done a lot of work to hone my cooking skills.
24.japanese: そういえば指揮官、料理はできるか？ふん、こう見えても私は己が胃袋を満足させるがために努力したのだぞ
24.japaneseTL: By the way, Commander, can you cook? Hmm, I may not look like it but in order to satisfy my own appetite, I have been working hard on it.
24.english: By the way, Commander, are you a good cook? Hmm? Despite my appearances, I've spent many hours honing my skills to sate my own appetite.

25.chinese: 呵呵，指挥官，怎么样，我的厨艺令你满意吗？尽管吃吧，看到你这么满足，我也很高兴
25.chineseTL: Hoho, Commander, how is it? Are you satisfied by my cooking? Eat as much as you want, seeing you enjoy it so much makes me happy too.
25.japanese: ふふ、指揮官、どうだ？我が料理の腕に感服したか？さあ、好きなだけ食べるがいい。あなたの食いっぷりを見ると、私も嬉しいのだぞ
25.japaneseTL: Fufu, Commander, how is it? Are you impressed by my cooking? Here, eat as much as you like. Seeing you enjoy the food so much makes me happy too.
25.english: How's that, commander? Are you impressed by my cooking abilities? Here, have as much you desire. Seeing you enjoy my food pleases me.

26.chinese: 指挥官，你也开始学习厨艺了吗？呵呵，那真是太好了，能吃到你为我做的饭是我的荣幸，我很期待
26.chineseTL: Commander, are you learning how to cook as well? Hehe, that's great. It will be my pleasure to be able to eat the food you will make for me, I look very much forward to it.
26.japanese: 指揮官、あなたも料理の勉強を始めたのか？ふん、それは重畳――私のために作ってくれた料理を食べるのは楽しみだぞ
26.japaneseTL: Commander, are you learning how to cook as well? Hmm, that's splending. I look forward to eat the food you will be preparing for me.
26.english: Commander, so you're learning how to cook? Hmm, colour me impressed. I look forward to trying the dish that you're making for me.

27.chinese: 美食和战斗是我的两大乐趣，我可以孤军奋战，但美食一个人享用实在是太寂寞了，能遇到跟我一起分享的你，实在是太好了
27.chineseTL: Cuisine and battles are my two greatest pleasures. While I am capable of fighting alone, it feels too lonely to be having meals by myself. To be able to meet someone to share with like you, I am truly glad.
27.japanese: 食事と戦闘は我が楽しみの両輪――まあ、戦いは一人でもできるが、ディナーを一人で楽しむのは寂しくて難儀なものだな。共に楽しんでくれるあなたと出会えたのは、本当に嬉しいことだ
27.japaneseTL: Cuisine and battles are my two pleasures. Well, while I can fight alone, dining by myself feels lonely and hard to enjoy. To be able to meet you, whom I can share these pleasures with, I am truly glad.
27.english: My greatest hobbies in life are food and fighting. While I am more than capable of fighting alone, dining by myself is quite difficult and lonesome. To be able to find someone who can share both of these things with me is truly a joyous thing.

28.chinese: “想要抓住一个人的心，就要先抓住他的胃”，你已经完全获得了我的心呢，指挥官，从今往后，也希望你能一直为我做饭
28.chineseTL: "The way to someone's heart is through their stomach". You have completely won over my heart. Commander, I hope you can always cook for me from now on.
28.japanese: 「心を掴む前に、胃袋を掴むべし」とは言ったものだが、これは胃袋を越えて、一気に私の心まで掴んだな。指揮官、これからもずっと料理を作ってくれないか？
28.japaneseTL: "The way to someone's heart is through their stomach" was the saying but, you managed to pass through my stomach and won over my heart right away. Commander, how about cooking for me forever from now on?
28.english: They say that "the quickest way to one's heart is through their stomach," but you've managed to win over both at once. Commander, shall we share all our meals together from now on?

29.chinese: 威尔士，可别再突然离开我了！
29.chineseTL: Wales, don't suddenly leave me again!
29.japanese: ウェールズ、急にいなくなるなよ！
29.english: Wales, you'd better not suddenly leave me again!

30.chinese: 约克，跟姐姐一起把战场撕碎吧
30.chineseTL: York, let's tear apart the battlefield with your sister.
30.japanese: 共に敵陣を引き裂いてくれよう！
30.japaneseTL: Let's tear apart the enemies together!
30.english: York, let us shatter our enemies together.

1.chinese: 久等了，指挥官……我很少穿礼服，所以稍微花了一些时间。那么，让我们出发吧。不过，今夜你才是主角呢，呵呵
1.chineseTL: I kept you waiting, Commander... I don't often wear dresses, so it took me a bit of time. Now, let's get going. But remember, you are the protagonist tonight, haha
1.japanese: 指揮官、待たせたな。ドレスを着るのはめったにないゆえ、いささか手間がかかったが……うむ、出発するとしよう。今夜の主役はあなただ。あははは
1.japaneseTL: Commander, I kept you waiting. I don't often wear dresses, it took some time to get ready... Umu, let's get going. The protagonist tonight is all you. Ahahaha
1.english: Sorry to keep you waiting, Commander... I don't get to wear a dress very often, so it took me a bit longer. Let's get going, then. Remember, you'll be the lead tonight. Haha~

2.chinese: 久等了，指挥官……我很少穿礼服，所以稍微花了一些时间。那么，让我们出发吧。不过，今夜你才是主角呢，呵呵
2.chineseTL: I kept you waiting, Commander... I don't often wear dresses, so it took me a bit of time. Now, let's get going. But remember, you are the protagonist tonight, haha

3.chinese: 牵起我的手，指挥官，我还不太适应穿着这样的礼服行走
3.chineseTL: Hold my hand, Commander. I am still not very used to walk in such a dress.

4.chinese: 唔…？衣服好像有些太紧了，指挥官，能不能帮我松一下背后的拉链？
4.chineseTL: Hmm...? The dress seems to be too tight. Commander, can you hep me loosen the back zipper a bit?

5.chinese: 陛下那边……有贝尔法斯特和胡德在，应当没有问题，指挥官，让我们尽情享受宴会吧
5.chineseTL: Her Majesty is over there... There shouldn't be issues with Belfast and Hood at her side. Commander, let us fully enjoy the banquet.

6.chinese: 宴会中发布任务……真是不解风情
6.chineseTL: A mission announcement right in the middle of the banquet... They really don't get it.

7.chinese: 这些奖励，就用来装点宴会吧
7.chineseTL: These rewards, let us use them to decorate the banquet.

8.chinese: 舞会的邀请？呵呵，指挥官，让我也一起去吧？
8.chineseTL: A ball invitation? Hehe, Commander, would you like me go with you too?

9.chinese: 指挥官，再不快点前往宴会的话，佳肴都要凉了
9.chineseTL: Commander, if we don't hurry to the banquet, the delicacies are going to get cold.

10.chinese: 指挥官，这个委托结束后先停一下吧，每个人都有享受宴会的资格
10.chineseTL: Commander, let them take a break now that the commission is complete. Everyone here should be able to enjoy the banquet.

11.chinese: 你们未免也太不识趣了！
11.chineseTL: You are all rather not very interesting!

12.chinese: 在今天挡在我的面前，是你们的不幸——
12.chineseTL: To stand in my way today, it was your misfortune-

13.chinese: 无论我怎样绽放光芒，一切荣光依然归于你，这并不是因为你是我的指挥官，而是因为你是你。所以，挺起胸膛吧，我的爱人，你值得拥有我，你值得拥有眼前的一切
13.chineseTL: No matter how much I shine, all the glory belongs to you. And that is not because you are my Commander, but because it is you. So, stand firm and be proud, my lover. You are worthy of me, you are worthy of anything.
